title: ASX rises; ANZ flags $651m profit hit
text:
William McInnes

Santos shares are trading higher this morning after positive drilling results at its Dorado well.

The company said the initial flow test of the Caley reservoir from the Dorado-3 appraisal well revealed the field's main oil pool was capable of producing flow rights at the higher end of its pre-drill expectations.

Flow testing over 12 hours achieved a maximum measured rate of approximately 11,100 barrels of oil per day and 21 million standard cubic feet of associated gas per day through a 68/64” choke, with the oil rate one of

the highest ever from a North West Shelf appraisal well test.

"The results are very encouraging for development of the shallow-water Dorado field, with the test indicating very high potential flow rates of around 30,000 barrels per day from each single production well in the Caley reservoir," said managing director and chief executive Kevin Gallagher.

"This positive result represents a significant step in progressing Dorado as one of Santos’ most exciting new development projects."
description: The local sharemarket is trading higher at the open; ANZ has flagged a $651 million profit hit due to increased remediation costs.
